pageContext.claim: “I retweeted…he was a professional agitator. He was having a fight with other guys there that were agitators that were younger. Did you see the clip? Do you see the clip of the young guys that were screaming, Get the hell out of here? They were fighting with them. Then he steps and he puts himself right in the way of these people. And then he takes something and starts putting it on their body, touching them or close. And somebody said it was a scanner, whatever it was. I'm not saying anything one way or the other. I'm just saying, What did he stand right in their path? And he moved right into their path. And the soldiers knew him.”
pageContext.analysis: It was not a retweet. Trump tweeted a conspiracy theory about Martin Gugino, who was critically injured when an advancing line of police officers in Buffalo pushed him and he fell backward, hitting his head. Two officers were fired after video of the encounter was broadcast by a local television station. "I watched, he fell harder than was pushed. Was aiming scanner," Trump said in his tweet. "Could be a set up?” The source for the news report cited by Trump was “The Conservative Treehouse,” in particular a blog post by an unidentified person labeled “Sundance.”
